history.content:
http://guide.berkeley.edu/courses/compsci/

In the listing for CS 70, Credit Restrictions are described as follows: "Credit Restrictions: Students will receive no credit for Computer Science 70 after taking Mathematics 55."

children.subject: Of course the instructor answer is quite clear, but you might consider sitting in on the Math 55 lectures instead of enrolling in the course as a way to prepare.  I'm not sure what the CS department's thoughts are on that, but many math professors would happily allow a student to sit in if there is space.

Also OP, if you want a course to boost your 70 grade without the credit restriction issues with 55, consider stat 134/140. They overlap pretty heavily with the second half of 70 but imo there’s still enough new stuff to stay interesting, and if you know 134 level probability solidly well the final for 70 will be easy. (The final is usually at least 2/3 probability and it’s half your exam grade, so you get almost as much bang for the buck as you would if you took 55.)

The one caveat is that 134/140 aren’t particularly easy classes; I thought 134 had harder material than 70 but with a slower pace.
If we already took Math 55, would taking CS 70 for no credit still allow us to use the grade received in 70 on the major app?
If I took Math55 and then CS70, would I be able to still use CS70 to fulfill prerequisites for other classes?

history.content:
I am currently enrolled in CS70, but I'm not sure if I feel ready to take it yet so I was hoping to get some advice. 
I was thinking about enrolling in Math55 this semester instead of CS70, so I could learn similar material as taught in CS70 and get the grade I need to declare the CS major when I take CS70 in the Spring. Do you think taking Math55 first would be a good idea? If not, how would you suggest I prepare for taking CS70 in the Spring? I don't have any exposure to discrete math so I don't think I'll be able to achieve the grade I need in 70 if I take it right now.
history.subject: Taking Math55 to prepare for CS70
